title: AD is getting buffed, but...
body:
Armor pen is also being nerfed.

Armor shred is being nerfed.

EC is going up in price.

Armor is getting buffed, which also raises the value of Thornmail.

Tanks are getting new items.

GA is losing MR(meaning ADCs take more damage 30 AD isn't much)

Tanks and Juggernauts are finally receiving a good MR item besides SV.

Health is only being nerfed a little bit.

Please do some research before hysterically posting angry circle jerks. Overall this patch is a net gain for survivability.

As for buffs to DD it seems Riot is trying to raise survivability across the board.

I don't think AD should be nerfed, but I think AP items need more of a solid framework like lethality and marksmen items.

The only problem with that is marksmen are consistent, mages are not. To date, all *standard* marksmen (as in, not wildly off meta like AD Zyra or what have you) share 3 main things in common: Range, mana use, and dealing the majority of their damage through autos (especially as the game progresses, even caster ADCs deal the bulk of their damage with AAs over the course of the game)

AP users are another story, since there are a vast variety of play styles available, including variation based on resource type, spell style, spell cost relative to their resource, cooldowns, etc. ADC items can be standardized because they are a standardized class, AP and mage items cannot, since everything fills a certain niche by default (even mainstays like Rabadon's for example)

So... if losing 10 ad on black cleaver is outweighed by the 100hp buff... then explain how +10 armor outweighs losing 75hp?
This just makes tanks that much weaker in lane and more easily forced out of lane... to fall further behind.
Not only does it make laning vs a bruiser or assassin harder for tanks provided said bruiser has sustain, but also it weakens their early/early-mid game teamfights and skirmishes vs enemy teams with both magic and physical damage (since they have no resistance vs the other type of damage). Furthermore, we cannot forget true damage. If people simply needed more armor, then why wouldn't they be building fewer hp+resistance items and more raw armor items {{item:3110}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3075}} ?

So not only is riot essentially taking the opposite of their stance on black cleaver (big hp>small ad turns into small armor> big hp), but also you can see by itemization and logic that losing 75hp for a whopping 10ish armor buff is in no way a buff.

10 armor = 200 gold
75 HP = 200 gold
10 AD = 350 gold
100HP = 266 gold

That means BC got a gold efficiency nerf while the tank items changes are neutral.

Now, please tell me that you are now going to complain about the BC nerf, because us poor AD casters got nerfed in comparison to tanks only due to ADCs abusing BC.

It is not about the cost of an item or it's gold value as per comparing cloth armor gold cost per armor vs hp gold cost on ruby crystal or anything like that. It is about the overall value champs get from the item(s). Maybe the gold value stays neutral, maybe not. But if tanks get forced out of lane that much more easily by bruisers, they will fall further behind in items and thus the change is less gold efficient even if 10 armor = 75 hp. Very simple math there sir/ma'am. Although now that I've learned there are updates to ad items as well - with less overall armor pen, the changes don't sound nearly so bad. Less armor pen means not as much of the extra armor gets negated by simply buying a last whisper item or black cleaver - meaning the lost hp doesn't matter AS MUCH at least in mid-late game when you have multiple items. At 0-2 items though, I still believe tanks will be weaker to some bruiser matchups, and thus their laning phase COULD easily still suffer.
